content: eight crafters were continuing more with our porky goodness and today we are
going to do a orc giant crossbow so this is gonna be a super fun project this is
part one of the project now one thing I want to stress on this is I use a lot of
bits and bobs in this project all of it is fairly easy to acquire but I just
want to say that you don't need exactly everything the same exact things that I
use you could substitute a lot of pieces out and make your own designs and that
kind of thing this is just a great general guide for making your own orc
giant crossbow so let's go to the table and start crafting that
got some of these craft sticks at the crafts are not sure exactly what they're
called but they're I guess ice cream spoons or something so then I have these
bamboo skewers I'm going to use these two to start the crossbow and see that
just I'm gonna put that on top there and that'll be the body of the crossbow so
what I'm going to do is I'm gonna mark where that skewer ends the bamboo skewer
and let's cut off the spoon and kind of sand it up a bit
and that'll be that'll lay on top of that so I'm going to do is I'm gonna
glue that on there with my goop my my friendly goop there that I love to use
and so just uh generally apply it stick it on there and then we got the start of
our crossbow and you can just use a toothpick in any excess off it squirts
out and for the bottom I'm going to put on this round wooden piece that I got at
the craft store so I'll just leave that on with some good ball so just take off
the excess and I got a small little spindle and some round wheel like pieces
of wood and I'm just going to glue those together to form the wheels for the
bottom of the crossbow or the ballista and so make sure those are solid and I
like the goop it's a very viscous so it's uh it holds the stuff together very
well while you're gluing it so I'll just pop some on there and I glue it to that
circular part on the bottom wipe off the excess with a toothpick and so we're
starting to get the shape there we've got some wheels on the bottom and now I
have some more plastic to tail skewers and I'm gonna get a couple of
these and I'm gonna start bending them be very gentle when you bend it's easy
to break these so you just want to apply a little bit of pressure and then bend
them that on this I'm gonna bend the skewers
out a little bit so you see I want to get that kind of a shape
okay then I'll cut the end off and I'll do it to the other one and I'll have to
that'll be the the bar of the crossbow so now I'm gonna use my goop and I'm
like glue those two on so I've got them kind of form to the shape I want and
I'll glue it to that front piece there the circular or the dome piece I put on
the bottom and that's the reason I put that on there so blue that goop on there
and I'll turn it over so it can set and there we go we got a nice crossbow shape
right there so it's starting to look good all right now some more details I
have this skull bead and I'm going to glue that on the front here and that'll
be a nice little detail little grizzly detail on there so let that set and
we'll be good to go for that also hold the bar is on extra well so I've got the
couple beads I've got these roundish beads and this kind of longer bead I'm
gonna glue these two onto it with the goop and this is going to be kind of
like the mechanical bit of the crossbow where this is where the rope is like
pulled back so there we go just some small beads there and I have this other
bead I think it looks like a gear so I want to use this as the pulley for the
crossbow to pull the rope back now I got these little rings at the craft store in
the jewelry section and they have these bars in them also what you think is
really cool and I'm gonna use this to just pop it into that bead and that'll
look like it's the like the crank that'll pull the crossbow back okay so
now I'm going to use my goop and fill that hole so I can put the crank in
there and there we go all set now I have I want to add a detail of the wheels I
have these really small beads and I cut off some toothpicks and when I put a
generous helping of goop on there because I want the toothpick to stick
also put the bead on there and then pick in it and that'll look like a spike
coming out of the wheel I really like that kind of or key detail there little
things like this that can really give it analogy okay so I'll do the other one
got both on there now I'll put the mechanical piece so that we did on to
the back of the crossbow so I'll put some goop on that generously apply the
goop and put it on the back there and that will serve two purposes it'll be a
cool detail as well as where the end of the arrow will sit we'll rest okay
or the bolt and there's the crank for the crossbow so pretty cool so it's
really coming together now so now I am going to take some toothpicks I'm just
gonna cut them in half okay and one is a little longer than the other cells from
that a bit and I just want to I'll sand them up first but I'm gonna have this
will be a nice little another or key detail I can add so I'm need some white
glue just so it'll be easier than the goop to try to apply these little
toothpicks and then I'm going to put it on the front just past where the bamboo
skewer goes so it looks like you know you could Ram somebody with the spikes
or something so kind of a just an extra or key detail on there and I'll just
blend the extra white glue into the piece you know it'll almost disappear
when it dries so there we go cool and I'm gonna add a little
reinforcement on the bottom so I got this
just a regular craft stick and I'm going to mark it where the wheels are and then
just cut it off sand it a little bit and then we'll just apply it to the bottom
so I'm like a little bit extra off there I don't want that round part off the
back too much and there we go so now I'll just apply that to the bottom with
my goop and we'll let it dry up so there yeah just a little bit of extra
reinforcement and wait okay cool it's really coming together really coming
together now here I'm going to use this hemp twine and this will make the bow
string for the crossbow so I'm going to cut it and I'll put it through that
skewer there and I'm gonna hold it up for a second with my thumb and then use
my hot glue and just glue that end there make sure it's glued well and let it sit
for a few seconds that way it'll be nice and solid for what you
have to do next a little extra on there so I'll scrape that off I'm going to go
around that back mechanical piece and then go into the skewer again on the
other side and make it tight and I'm going to pull it up and then use the hot
glue again to glue that part so there we go we have the nice easy super to do bow
string there okay so now I need to cut the excess awesome and use some small
